acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was assembled by the Lebanon Historical Society from a variety of local sources between 1999 and 2017. There were twelve identified donors, one anonymous donor, and four with no recorded source. Sources include, Harold Geer, John Champe, Eva Himmelstein, Jack Pelto, Julia Dutcher, Shirley Brodeur, Margaret and Robert McCaw, Peter Calvert, Glenn Pianka, the Connecticut Sons of the American Revolution, and The Town of Lebanon.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: In the years after WWII, the Lebanon Foundation sponsored a series of historical pageants which featured an epic play about the founding of the United States and a Boy Scout (and eventually Girl Scout) camporee on the Lebanon Green. Professionally produced and directed, Lebanon residents filled many of the roles in this production. Memorabilia, preserved in various households, was donated to the Historical Society beginning years before collections records were kept.

The Lebanon Foundation of New London identified itself as an organization founded to inspire Americanism; combatting the present day influences of Communism and fellow travelers; and for the restoration of Lebanon. The purpose is to forcibly bring to all, particularly through the Boy Scouts and Girl Scouts, a realization that our Americanism and happiness rest only in and as a result of sacrifice and hard work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This Collection includes 29 items, including but not limited to, pageant / camporee / church programs, bulletins, Boy Scout patches, newspaper articles, publications, pilgrimage plaque, photographs, and scripts.
